snippet: Opponents of an edict to add a half day of school a week say it was created without their consultation, lacks details and fails to address the middling performance of French schoolchildren.
abstract: French government plan to add half day of school per week has incited wave of protest from France's powerful teachers unions, parents associations and city governments, which say it was produced without their consultation, is short on details and fails to address deeper concerns about middling performance of French schoolchildren.
lead_paragraph: Opponents of an edict to add a half day of school a week say it was created without their consultation, lacks details and fails to address the middling performance of French schoolchildren.

headline.seo: French Plan to Add to Already Lengthy School Calendar Meets Resistance
headline.main: French Plan to Add to Already Lengthy School Days Angers Parents and Teachers
headline.print_headline: French Plan to Add to Already Lengthy School Days Angers Parents and Teachers

keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
